intro: Roupala colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian roupala, is a small evergreen tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are fragrant and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Roupala colombiana is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations.
